intro: Strobilanthes tonkinensis var. sarmentosus, commonly known as the Vietnamese strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered inflorescences with small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
